Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel with helpful staff in an okay location”
Reviews.Author: MallishKumar
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel with helpful staff in an okay location. We arrived early in the morning and they checked in and provided us with breakfast at no extra cost. When asked for a room change later in the day (the streetfacing room was quite noisy), they did accomodate that request as well. The room is decent sized and was clean & comfortable. They do provide toiletries (if possible get your own toothbrush & paste, the one they give is too small to use) and bathroom slippers. Few things to note about the room are - Small TV with only Turkish Channels (I am sure you wudnt travel all the way to Istanbul to watch tv, so you needn't bother), No Mini Bar, No AC (In Summer it could get real painful), there was a safe (but how safe the safe was, was a concern). If you can overlook these concerns, the room is absolutely fine. The breakfast is almost the same everyday. Not a great choice but it is manageable. The hotel has a small health club (few equipments), free access to their Sauna and Hamam (additional charges for personlized services like massage - 115 Turkish Liras, scrub etc.) The downside to this hotel is the location. Though it is near to the Pazartekke tram stop, it is a good 6 to 7 tram stops away from Sultanahmet. Please be aware that most of the monuments are in and around the Sultanahmet area. Though the frequency of the trams are quite good (one in every few minutes), the trams are normally crowded and could be painfully slow. It could take 20 minutes to reach Sultanahmet area. But due to the crowd in the tram, those 20 minutes could take forever. Taksim square is quite a distance from the hotel and if you get late you will have to take a taxi (last tram is around 00:00 hours) from the square and it could get expensive. So the location could be a concern. If you book from their hotel website, they do provide free pick up and drop to the airport. But it is good that you confirm this personally with the manager. They did try to charge me for the airport drop though i booked from their website. I had to speak to their manager to get this issue resolved (but this delayed me by 15-20 minutes for the flight!). You should try to reach their manager directly over the phone (some follow up required), email responses do take considerable time. Overall if you get his hotel in a decent price, go ahead and book it. Else you should look around for some decent hotel in the Sultanahmet area (Will save you precious time and liras on travel). Few Tips on Istanbul (Not related to the hotel review) 1. Do not exchange money in the airport. They charge 4% commission. Do it in the numerous exchange offices in the city at no commission. 2. Trams do not use Akbil any more. You will have to buy a Istanbul Kart. The deposit charges vary from kiosk to kiosk (7 Liras to 10 Liras). The savings are marginal if you are there only for 3-4 days if you take a Istanbul Kart. Also there is a risk that all kiosk owners do not refund the deposit and there is no guarantee that you will get your full deposit. 3. Trams/Ferries operate only until 00:00 Midnight. Decide and agree on the fare before taking a taxi. 4. Best place to stay is in and around Sultanahmet area.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: nicu_11
Reviews.Content: 4 stars're on a really good price as a central breakfast such a variety of appropriate staff and very good quality cleaning

Reviews.Title: “It was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: saito75
Reviews.Content: Everything in the hotel was excelent The room was very big - the bed was comfortable The breakfast was rich and tasty The service was wonderful We will recomend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for easy access”
Reviews.Author: Leannamarie63
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel to public transport (the train) was brilliant. Watch belongings on the train as we were robbed within a minute of getting on, trains are jam packed. Was very easy access to all the great tourist sites. The couple of minutes walk from the hotel to train was easy but you had to watch where you walked as very bad footpaths, holes in sidewalk and debris lying around. First impression of the area was not good. Bit of a distance to travel from the airport. Reception staff were lovely and helped with information as much as they could. The staff (all three ladies) from the Turkish Bath area a couple of floors down were not able to communicate at all in english with me. They missed out on customers because of this problem. Did not have any idea what I was asking even though I tried to show with signs using my hands - washing, shower etc. Had no idea what I was asking for when I said "toilet". Breakfast dining area had tables situated around the indoor pool. The variety and presentation of the food was more than adequate. Bedding and towels were clean but the rest of the room required a good clean. Moved the bed as I dropped my pen, the floor was covered with dust and there was a used condoms lying there.

Reviews.Title: “Usual Average 4star”
Reviews.Author: Vasios
Reviews.Content: Stayed there as part fo a group of 15 people so I can't really comment on the value for money as I don't know what is their usual walk-in price. The hotel is a typicall 4 star average hotel. Nothing impressive, nothing really dissapointing. First room we were offered wasn't cleaned well and we asked for a change which was done in 5 minutes with no hassle. The hotel offers free sauna/turkish bath, I can't really comment on the quality of the facilities since I haven't been to many more but they seemed nice to me. Location is not great but there is a tram station just 30 meters from the hotel which can take you to Sultanahment (Blue Mosque, Agia Sofia etc) in 20 minutes. Our roum was very hot for no apparent reason (heat was off) so we had trouble to sleep. In my opinion you should choose this hotel only related to price, If you are offered a price less than 90â‚¬, it's a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay with affordable prices”
Reviews.Author: Mavlyuda
Reviews.Content: This place has a full package everyone is looking for. Clean and bright rooms, high quality service and welcoming staff. For the price we have paid for this hotel was a heaven :) Suits to everyone's taste no matter it is a family, a banch of tourists or group of friends.

Reviews.Title: “If you wanna have good time and impress your partners go toTopkapi Inter”
Reviews.Author: serdar_kakayev
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and have to meet with different people. I set my partners at Topkapi Hotel and they were really impressed from its service. Rooms are very clean and neat. They provide wonderful food, specially service. Waiters are perfect. They do their bests to make you comfortable! In Turkey people know how to serve!! I would highly recommend to stay at this wonderful Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “an excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: atiqq
Reviews.Content: After a long time I came to Turkey, Istanbul. I stayed at Interistanbbul hotel for whole my trip duration. it was very nice and descent hotel. The receptionist was very nice and polite :) If I would go to istanbul, i will stay there again. Also, i recommend this hotel for those who are planning to stay in istanbul. i am glad i chose this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “They were not very kindly with us!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: eliechris
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice but they are not very nice with us...... I ask to they the price of the room and the girl to the reception answer:" in turkish lira o euro?" I answer" Turkish lira please!!!!" She said" 75 turkish lira" But when we paid they asked to us 80 euro.............. So I think is better to have an hotel in sulthanamet, because when we came back to Istanbul we try a lot of hotel more ecomic, more friendly and near to the historical site of istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: DejanK
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, close to new, very exciting Panorama 1453 Museum, and the walls of Old Constantinople walls. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Warm friendy welcome for two weary travellers”
Reviews.Author: helenmae
Reviews.Content: We arrived early morning and were given early check-in at no extra cost and even offered breakfast, also at no extra cost. The room was clean and comfortable, the staff very friendly and accommodating although they couldn't speak very good English. Dinner was excellent and breakfast adequate even though the choice was not great. Lovely little secluded outdoor seating area for smokers where one could order drinks from the reasonably priced bar, not often found elswhere. We will definitely return next September, hopefully for longer than 4 nights. Thank you for such a wonderfully warm welcome. But one downside to the area in which the hotel is situated: if you are a cat lover you will need to close your eyes to the very many pitiful strays. In fact Turkey as a nations should be disgusted at its lack of humanity toward these poor creatures and something must be done about it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: sograd89
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a great vacation at Hotel InterTopkapi. The staff was extremely friendly, especially the waiters and busboys. The staff (except for the reception) doesn't speak very well english but you can easily understand them if you pay enough attention, but they speak excellent german and russian. The rooms are very large and very nice decorated and if you get a room in the east side of the hotel you will have a great view over Istanbul's skyscrapers. The distance to the historical area isn't great only 3,4 tram stations. The tram is air conditioned and goes very fast (10-15 min to Sultanhmed), comes very quickly (every 2 min) and the ticket costs 1,5 lyra (it's more than the bus ticket but it's totally worth it) . The hotel has free parking which is great because it can take you hours to find a parking place in Istanbul (unless you take your car to a garage) and the gas station is nearby. Also there is a little mousque near the hotel but don't worry about the noise because they only make the call on the speakers that the all sermon. All in all I believe it is a great place to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't like at all”
Reviews.Author: RedRoseRo
Reviews.Content: I was many times in Turkey and as I didn't find free rooms to the hotels that I know, I found this hotel. I expected to be not so far from Sultanahmet as they said, but in fact it hasn't a good location. Our room was very big, which I liked, beds are also big and confortable, the room is elegant but we didn't find even a bottle of water and they never put something in the bar. The bathroom is nice, with a lot of shampoons, conditionners, soaps but the shower didn't work proprely and same the hairdryer had a hole so i was afraid not to electrocute myself. But we had new slippers which was very nice. We couldn't use internet also we had a laptop, we had an argue with the receptionist on this aspect and finally he accepted to let us use internet for one hour, once, not every day of course. He said that we can use their computer from the lobby but it was all the time busy there and no privacy because everybody could watch the monitor. The brekfast was some kind of poor food, same every day, nothing traditional and not enough food for everybody because if you wake up a little later surelly you will not find nothing and they even don't care and also I didn't like the caffee. For food I can give 2 stars to this hotel. It also has a pool but was very cold so nobody could use it. The personal is not very friendly, they look you suspicious every moment and you can't see even a smile on their faces so you can feel embarrased every moment althoug one of the personal's members when we had a problem with our door because the key card was blocked(another problem) he came after us because he saw we are girls and asked for our mobile telephone number which I couldn't believe he can dare this. But the hotel is elegant and the elevators are very modern. The location of the hotel is also not very good, you can not find nothing near, but the tram station is almost near the hotel, just 1 minute walking away and there are like 9-10 stations to Sultanahmet, but if you want to come back to hotel after midnight you can use only a taxi which it will be expensive. For sure we will not go again there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: holidays2
Reviews.Content: Myself and my family have just returned from a week in Istanbul. We had never been to Istanbul before, and booked the trip very last minute, so hotels were hard to find. The ideal location is Sultanahmet, however most good hotels were fully booked when we looked. This hotel is in Topkapi, which is literally just a 15 minute drive by taxi to Sultanahmet, which is close enough! Before booking, I emailed the manager as some reviews on trip advisor worried me e.g. transfers to and from airport are not free, breakfast is awful, rooms unclean....but I was assured by the manager that this is not the case. As promised we were greeted at the airport by our comfortable transfer to the hotel. The hotel has decent sized rooms, simple but sufficient, with a clean bathroom (a must!!). There is a pool, gym and sauna, all free for guests..and facilities to pay for a massage or turkish bath. Breakfast was simple but had more than enough for all tastes... Any queries were promptly answered by the manager, who was very accommodating. Only minor bad points (for us)...the hotel hosts club mea, their own night club which is noisy during the night...and some of the reception staff are a bit moody! All in all I would recommend this hotel to others, for the price you pay it is well worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “it sucks”
Reviews.Author: nidu
Reviews.Content: they say it is the 4 star hotel but hardly any 4 star hotel would charge money for using even the swimming pool and the gym and for pick n drop services to and from the airport. the waiters are horrid rude blunt and stuck up so is the management. they dont greet u nicely never with a smile. room service is pathetic and no food or drinks are allowed from outside not even water. the fridge in the room hardly works and otherwise the food there water there is very expensive the breakfast was very very basic and u had to pay extra to get an omellate or fried egg etc the hotel was horridddd it was sooooooooooooooo bad

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Florin_Bucuresti
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel with big rooms (not huge but enought large).Rooms are very clean and food is ok. I fully recomand you this hotel.No surprisez ! Fair price !

HotelInfo.Name: Topkapi Inter Istanbul Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Topkapi Caddesi 8, Istanbul 34270, Turkey
